definition: to pass to the next generation
to pass on/to spread/to transmit/to infect/to transfer/to circulate/to conduct (electricity)
to substitute/to act on behalf of others/to replace/generation/dynasty/age/period/(historical) era/(geological) eon

sentences.english: Objective To explore a method for primary culture and subculture of human atrial myocardial cells.
sentences.chinese: 目的探索人心房肌細胞的原代及傳代培養方法。

sentences.english: The cells were passaged by mechanical methods, frozen and thawed by general procedure.
sentences.chinese: 採用機械方法傳代，常規方法凍存和復甦。

sentences.english: Therefore, ANITA is a complex group originated from different lineages.
sentences.chinese: 因此ANITA是一個源於不同傳代線的複合羣。

sentences.english: Most of them had inheritable stability after several generation.
sentences.chinese: 幾次傳代培養後，大多數具有遺傳穩定性。

sentences.english: They were passaged till monolayer cells spread to more than 80% of the bottom of the culture bottle.
sentences.chinese: 至單層細胞鋪滿近培養瓶底的80%以上時進行傳代。

sentences.english: After a series of passages, the hereditary properties of the 4 fusion strains were found to be stable. Micechallenged.
sentences.chinese: 連續傳代證明4個融合株的雙親遺傳特性是穩定的。

sentences.english: The cells could be differentiated to form EBs again, and could be re-expanded from secondary EBs.
sentences.chinese: 細胞能反覆傳代，並可在體外再次分化和殘留。

sentences.english: Sheep Fibroblast cells derived from adult sheep ear were cultivated and passaged.
sentences.chinese: 用成年綿羊耳部皮膚細胞進行培養傳代。

sentences.english: Methods The fresh human hilar cholangiocarcinoma specimen was cultured.
sentences.chinese: 方法將人肝門部膽管癌標本進行細胞培養，傳代。

sentences.english: The subculture could not be established.
sentences.chinese: 傳代培養細胞不能增生。

sentences.english: Cells well grew after 20 times of passages.
sentences.chinese: 細胞傳代20次後，仍生長良好。

sentences.english: After subculture, confluence was occurred in 1-2 weeks.
sentences.chinese: 傳代培養細胞可在1～2周匯合成片。
